S4.T2.caption: Performance comparison of our framework on LLaMa2-7B-chat with baselines across diverse datasets. The results of the best-performing baseline are denoted with an. The results of our method which outperform other prompt-based methods are indicated with, while those that surpass the best-performing baseline are highlighted in. The performance improvement of RPP/RPP+ compared with the best-performing prompt-based method is listed in the “improvement”.

Improvement0.78%0.490.450.790.510.490.880.540.48
references: To answer RQ1, we evaluate the effectiveness of our framework on LLaMa2-7B-chat by comparing the performance of RPP/RPP+ with diverse baselines. We adopt the evaluating metrics of NDCG@1, NDCG@5, and NDCG@10 to access LLMs’ capability in ranking items, the results are listed in Table                  2                .With task-wise prompts through manual prompts or enumeration, LLaMa2-7B-chat exhibits inferior recommendation performance compared to traditional recommender models and few-shot methods. However, with the instance-wise prompt personalization implemented in the RPP/RPP+, the frozen pre-trained LLaMa2-7B-chat surpasses these baseline models across a variety of datasets.For example, the best-performing baseline in traditional recommender models, SASRec, surpasses the best-performing prompt-based method (enumeration) by                          0.64                               0.64                              0.64                       ,                          0.48                               0.48                              0.48                       , and                          0.43                               0.43                              0.43                       in NDCG@1, NDCG@5, and NDCG@10 metrics, respectively, on the ML-1M dataset. This validates the weakness of task-wise prompts for LLMs. In contrast, RPP demonstrates superior performance compared to the leading baseline in traditional recommender models (SASRec), achieving improvements of                          0.14                               0.14                              0.14                       ,                          0.01                               0.01                              0.01                       , and                          0.02                               0.02                              0.02                       in terms of the NDCG@1, NDCG@5, and NDCG@10 metrics on the ML-1M. Moreover, RPP outperforms the best prompt-based methods (enumeration) with improvements of                          0.78                               0.78                              0.78                       ,                          0.49                               0.49                              0.49                       , and                          0.45                               0.45                              0.45                       regarding the NDCG@1, NDCG@5, and NDCG@10 metrics on the ML-1M. The experimental findings for RPP+ exhibit the same outcomes. This proves the benefit of instance-wise prompts of RPP/RPP+. We conduct multiple tests and the minimal standard deviations demonstrate that the performance improvements resulting from RPP/RPP+ are statistically significant.This illustrates that due to the ability to personalize prompts from instance-wise, RPP/RPP+ enables LLMs to comprehend users’ personalized intents better and provide more accurate recommendations.

references: The ablation study explores the impact of personalizing each pattern (           i.e.,          “role-playing”, “history records”, “reasoning guidance,” and “output format”) on facilitating LLMs’ recommendation ability. Specifically, we perform experiments on the frozen LLaMa2-7B-chat with 4 variations of RPP/RPP+, where only one pattern in the prompts is personalized by the corresponding agent. As shown in Table                  4                ,                  5                , and Figure                  3                , personalizing any of the patterns can enhance the performance of LLMs to rank items, and the full framework of RPP/RPP+ attains the highest performance. Personalizing “reasoning guidance” yields the greatest benefits compared with other patterns, providing interpretability for recommendations and demonstrating the effectiveness of the personalized reasoning process in accurately analyzing user preferences. Besides, “role-playing” and “output format” underscore LLMs’ inherent sensitivity to prompts that modifications to the prompt expression can lead to LLMs’ better output. The “history records” confirms the impact of users’ short or long-term interaction history on recommendations.This emphasizes that decomposing the prompt into four patterns and individually tailoring them can contribute to LLMs’ recommendations.
